attributes.action: Stop the siting of a GDF for nuclear waste in South Holderness
attributes.additional_details: As is indicated in the preliminary information being supplied to residents of the area, the facility will only be sited with the acceptance of the local population. This petition is to demonstrate that the facility will be unwelcome in this area and there is a demonstratable majority opposition to it, and as such the area be withdrawn from consideration for the facility.
attributes.background: Indicate to Nuclear Waste Services (LLW Repository Limited and Radioactive Waste Management Limited ) along with local government that the local communities of the South Holderness region are unwilling to host the Geological Disposal Facility for Nuclear waste.

rejection.details:
We can’t accept petitions that request action at a local level.
 
You could ask your MP to take action on your concerns about this issue, including by asking them to present a public (paper) petition about this.
 
You can find contact details for your local MP here: https://members.parliament.uk/FindYourMP
 
And you can find out how to ask your MP to present a public (paper) petition here: https://www.parliament.uk/get-involved/sign-a-petition/paper-petitions/
 
You could also raise this issue with the Government department responsible for nuclear waste. You can find contact details for the Department for Energy Security & Net Zero here: https://www.gov.uk/government/organisations/department-for-energy-security-and-net-zero
